Mark,

What an interesting idea.  I've never considered instrumenting 
func=
tional code in a manner "altering" unit test execution. 

However, the noti=
on of instrumenting Javadoc is an elegant solution to 
the indirection impo=
sed by a descriptor document - without 
(technically) altering the function=
al code.

Being out of ideas for a v. 1.2 release - thanks for alleviating =
my 
spare-time problem :-).

     http://gtcgroup.com/util/index.html

_Mar=
vin

--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, Mark Levison <mlevison@...> wrote:
>
> M=
arvin - I've had a good look and it looks very interesting. The one
> thing=
 I'm leary of is the separate XML file to mark the cases to
> ignore. Have =
you considered using Javadoc tags that you could pick up
> via reflection? =
This has the distinct advantage that the tags to
> ignore a method pair are=
 tied to the methods.
> 
> Otherwise it looks very interesting.
>
